clinical_study.brief_title: Perichondrium Autograft in Refractory Necrotizing Scleritis
clinical_study.official_title: Autologous Perichondrium Transplantation for Replacement of Stem Cells and Their Niche in the Treatment of Necrotizing Scleritis

lead_sponsor.agency: Chung-Ang University Hosptial, Chung-Ang University College of Medicine

collaborator.agency: Ministry of Science, ICT and Future Planning

clinical_study.source: Chung-Ang University Hosptial, Chung-Ang University College of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock:
Necrotizing scleritis with severe ischemia is refractory to conventional treatment because of avascular necrosis.
The investigators assessed the therapeutic efficacy and safety of autologous perichondrium transplantation in patients with severe ischemic necrotizing scleritis, and analyzed the therapeutic effects.

detailed_description.textblock:
Ischemic necrotizing scleritis patients who showed persistent and progressive scleral melting were included in this study.
Perichondrium tissue was harvested from the patient's ear cartilage and transplanted to reconstruct the scleral defect after the necrotic tissue removal.

primary_outcome.measure: Success Rate of Repair of Scleral Defects
primary_outcome.description: Success Rate of Repair of Scleral Defects

intervention.description: Perichondrium tissue was harvested from the patient's ear cartilage and transplanted to reconstruct the scleral defect.
